collection_empty_invalid.name: No collections passed in
collection_empty_invalid.description: You must pass in at least one collection to export.

columns_empty_invalid.name: No columns passed in
columns_empty_invalid.description: You must pass in at least one column to export; otherwise, omit the parameter entirely.

columns_invalid.name: Invalid columns passed in
columns_invalid.description: You passed in at least one column that is not valid for the collection you're exporting.

name_already_exists.name: Name already exists
name_already_exists.description: The name of the tag already exists.

name_too_long.name: Name too long
name_too_long.description: The name of the tag is too long.

once.name: Once
once.description: A subscriber can only respond to this survey once.

once_per_email.name: Once per email
once_per_email.description: A subscriber can respond to this survey once per email.

username_already_exists.name: Username already exists
username_already_exists.description: A newsletter already exists with that username.

irrelevant.name: Irrelevant
irrelevant.description: Items in an RSS feed are marked as irrelevant if they do not have a publish date associated with them or if the publish date came before the RSS feed itself was connected to Buttondown.

skipped.name: Skipped
skipped.description: Items in an RSS feed are marked as 'skipped' if the RSS feed itself is paused or inactive in Buttondown when the item is processed. To send this item, you must manually process & send it using Buttondown's writing interface.

failing.name: Failing
failing.description: Buttondown cannot retrieve items from this feed. It will continue to attempt to do so until it gives up, at which point the automation will be set to `inactive`.

every.name: Every new item
every.description: Act every single time a new item is added to the RSS feed.

weekly.name: Weekly
weekly.description: Act every week, compiling a digest of new items.

monthly.name: Monthly
monthly.description: Act every month, compiling a digest of new items.

import.name: Import
import.description: This subscriber was imported from another service.

organic.name: Organic
organic.description: This subscriber subscribed to your newsletter of their own volition.

admin.name: Admin
admin.description: This subscriber was added by a member of Buttondown support staff.

user.name: User
user.description: This subscriber was added by a user with write permissions for subscribers within the Buttondown dashboard.

draft.name: Draft
draft.description: Draft emails are only visible to you and are not sent out to subscribers.

about_to_send.name: About to send
about_to_send.description:
This email has been queued to send out to subscribers, and will be sent automatically within a few minutes.

If you're seeing that an email you just sent out is 'stuck' here, worry not — Buttondown sometimes takes a little bit longer to send out emails to ensure deliverability, but once it's marked as 'about to send' it will get sent out.

scheduled.name: Scheduled
scheduled.description: This email has been scheduled to send out to subscribers at a specific time. This specific time is available on the email as its `publish_date`.

in_flight.name: In flight
in_flight.description:
This email is currently being sent out to subscribers, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.

Some emails, especially those with large subscriber lists, may take a while to send out — Buttondown sends emails out in batches to ensure deliverability, so if you're seeing an email 'stuck' here, it's because our systems have detected that that's the optimal way to reach your subscribers.

imported.name: Imported
imported.description: This email was imported from another service, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.

managed_by_rss.name: Managed by RSS
managed_by_rss.description: This email was created by an external feed, and has not yet been finalized and sent out by Buttondown.

deleted.name: Deleted
deleted.description: This email has been deleted, and is no longer visible in your web archives.

paused.name: Paused
paused.description: This email has been paused, and is not visible in your web archives.

sent.name: Sent
sent.description: This email has been sent out to subscribers, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.

errored.name: Errored
errored.description: This email has encountered an error while sending out to subscribers, and is not visible in your web archives.

api.name: API
api.description: This email was created via the API.

import.name: Import
import.description: This email was imported from another service.

app.name: App
app.description: This email was created via the Buttondown web app.

external_feed.name: External feed
external_feed.description: This email was created by an external RSS feed.

public.name: Public
public.description: Public emails are sent out to all of your subscribers and are available in your web archives.

private.name: Private
private.description: Private emails are sent out to all of your subscribers but are not viewable in your web archives.

premium.name: Premium
premium.description: Premium emails are sent out to only paying subscribers (including those with gift subscriptions or on a free trial), and only premium subscribers can view them in online archives.

free.name: Free
free.description: Free emails are sent out only to subscribers who are not paying for your newsletter (so you can send specific emails to convince them to pay, for instance!)

not_started.name: Not started
not_started.description: The export has not yet started.

in_progress.name: In progress
in_progress.description: The export is currently being processed.

error.name: Error
error.description: The export was unable to be completed. Buttondown is looking into it.

subscriber.replied.name: subscriber.replied
subscriber.replied.description: Whenever a subscriber has replied to one of your emails.

subscriber.created.name: subscriber.created
subscriber.created.description: Whenever a new subscriber is created.

subscriber.unsubscribed.name: subscriber.unsubscribed
subscriber.unsubscribed.description: When a subscriber has manually unsubscribed from your newsletter.

subscriber.confirmed.name: subscriber.confirmed
subscriber.confirmed.description: When a subscriber has confirmed that they are enrolled in your newsletter. (For newsletters without double opt-in, this event is created immediately after `subscriber.created`.)

subscriber.trial_started.name: subscriber.trial_started
subscriber.trial_started.description: When the trial has started for a subscriber. (For newsletters with automatic free trials, this will be created immediately after `subscriber.confirmed`.)

subscriber.trial_ended.name: subscriber.trial_ended
subscriber.trial_ended.description: When the trial has ended for a subscriber.

subscriber.paid.name: subscriber.paid
subscriber.paid.description: When a subscriber has enrolled in your newsletter's paid offering.

subscriber.churned.name: subscriber.churned
subscriber.churned.description: When a subscriber has unenrolled from your newsletter's paid offering.

subscriber.clicked.name: subscriber.clicked
subscriber.clicked.description: When a subscriber has clicked a link in one of your emails.

subscriber.updated.name: subscriber.updated
subscriber.updated.description: When a subscriber's notes or metadata has changed.

email.created.name: email.created
email.created.description: Whenever a new email is created and begins delivery. Note that event happens immediately before the emails themselves are sent.

email.sent.name: email.sent
email.sent.description: Whenever an email has finished its delivery. Note that event happens immediately after all emails have been sent, but some email events may not have finished processing.

email.deleted.name: email.deleted
email.deleted.description: Whenever an email has been deleted.

email.status.changed.name: email.status.changed
email.status.changed.description: Whenever an email's status has changed (e.g. from 'draft' to 'sent'.) The `metadata` field will contain the previous and new statii in 'old_value' and 'new_value' respectively.

memberful.subscription.created.name: memberful.subscription.created
memberful.subscription.created.description: Whenever a new subscription is created in Memberful.

memberful.subscription.deleted.name: memberful.subscription.deleted
memberful.subscription.deleted.description: Whenever a subscription is deleted in Memberful.

memberful.member.updated.name: memberful.member.updated
memberful.member.updated.description: Whenever a member changes their email address in Memberful.

stripe.subscription.activated.name: stripe.subscription.activated
stripe.subscription.activated.description: Whenever a subscription is activated in Stripe.

stripe.subscription.churning.name: stripe.subscription.churning
stripe.subscription.churning.description: Whenever a subscription is churning in Stripe.

stripe.subscription.deactivated.name: stripe.subscription.deactivated
stripe.subscription.deactivated.description: Whenever a subscription is deactivated in Stripe.

stripe.customer.updated.name: stripe.customer.updated
stripe.customer.updated.description: Whenever a customer changes their email address in Stripe.

automation.invoked.name: automation.invoked
automation.invoked.description: Whenever an automation is manually invoked (e.g. by a webhook or API call).

social_mention.created.name: social_mention.created
social_mention.created.description: Whenever your newsletter is mentioned on another website such as Reddit, Twitter, Bluesky, etc.

not_started.name: Not started
not_started.description: The bulk action has not yet started.

in_progress.name: In progress
in_progress.description: The bulk action is currently being processed.

failed.name: Error
failed.description: The bulk action was unable to be completed. Buttondown is looking into it.

apply_tags.name: Apply tags
apply_tags.description: This action requires two additional parameters within `metadata`: `tag_id` (the ID of the tag which you'd like to either add or remove to the list of subscribers) and `action` (which can be either `add` or `remove`).

apply_metadata.name: Apply metadata (to subscribers)
apply_metadata.description: This action requires two additional parameters within `metadata`: `action` (which can be either `add`, `set`, or `remove`), and `metadata` (the value of the metadata which you'd like to either add or remove to the list of subscribers).

send_emails.name: Send emails
send_emails.description: This action requires one additional parameter within `metadata`: `email_id` (the ID of the email which you'd like to send).

regular.name: Regular
regular.description: Normal subscribers who have not unsubscribed or deactivated in any way.

trialed.name: Trialed
trialed.description: Subscribers that are temporarily receiving a premium subscription to your newsletter.

unpaid.name: Unpaid
unpaid.description: Subscribers who have not yet purchased a subscription to your newsletter.

gifted.name: Gifted
gifted.description: Subscribers that have been gifted free premium subscriptions.

churning.name: Churning
churning.description: Subscribers who have elected to not renew their subscription to your newsletter and will become unpaid subscribers at the end of their current billing period.

unactivated.name: Unactivated
unactivated.description: Subscribers who have not yet confirmed their email or opted in.

paused.name: Paused
paused.description: Subscribers that are on a temporary hold from their premium subscription, but are still subscribed to your newsletter.

unsubscribed.name: Unsubscribed
unsubscribed.description: Subscribers that have or have been unsubscribed from your newsletter.

spammy.name: Spammy
spammy.description: Subscribers that have been deemed spammy by Buttondown's automated systems.

undeliverable.name: Undeliverable
undeliverable.description: Subscribers who have been unable to receive their email.

complained.name: Complained
complained.description: Subscribers that have registered a complaint with their email provider. Buttondown will not try to send them any future emails; no action is required on your part.

malformed.name: Malformed
malformed.description: Subscribers whose email appears to be invalid.

removed.name: Removed
removed.description: Subscribers who have been explicitly removed by the newsletter (notably, this does not mean unsubscribers: use /v1/unsubscribers for that!)

disabled.name: Disabled
disabled.description: Subscribers who have been disabled by the newsletter.

disposable.name: Disposable
disposable.description: Subscribers who have been deemed disposable by Buttondown's automated systems.

past_due.name: Past due
past_due.description: Subscribers who technically have active paid subscriptions, but have not paid their invoices in time.

churned.name: Churned
churned.description: Subscribers which were previously premium subscribers, but have since churned but are not unsubscribed.

change_email_address.name: Change email address
change_email_address.description: Change the email address of a subscriber.

gift_premium_subscription.name: Gift premium subscription
gift_premium_subscription.description: Gift a premium subscription to a subscriber.

ungift_premium_subscription.name: Ungift premium subscription
ungift_premium_subscription.description: Remove a gifted premium subscription from a subscriber.

send_discord_invitation.name: Send Discord invitation
send_discord_invitation.description: Send a Discord invitation to a subscriber.

send_github_invitation.name: Send GitHub invitation
send_github_invitation.description: Send a GitHub invitation to a subscriber.

send_email.name: Send email
send_email.description: Send an email to a subscriber.

shopify_unsubscribe.name: Unsubscribe from Shopify
shopify_unsubscribe.description: Unsubscribe a subscriber from your Shopify store.

unsubscribe_subscriber.name: Unsubscribe from Buttondown
unsubscribe_subscriber.description: Unsubscribe a subscriber from your newsletter.

send_notification.name: Send notification
send_notification.description: Send a notification to the newsletter author.

forward_reply.name: Forward reply
forward_reply.description: Forward the reply to a given recipient.

classic.name: Classic
classic.description: A plaintext template that puts emphasis on your content.

plaintext.name: Plaintext
plaintext.description: A plaintext (like, literally plaintext, no HTML at all) template for the truly minimalist.

naked.name: Naked
naked.description: The email body itself is used as the template, with no outside scaffolding provided by Buttondown.
